item.title: 欧洲监管机构称批准中国喷气机需要时间
item.description: 欧洲航空安全监管机构的高级官员告诉路透社记者，该机构将不惜一切代价批准中国的C919客机，这打击了中国政府迅速打入以飞机短缺和波音安全危机为标志的市场的希望。【原文：Europe's air safety regulator will take whatever time is needed to approve China's C919 passenger jet, its top official told Reuters, dampening Beijing's hopes of quickly breaking into a market marked by jet shortages and a Boeing safety crisis.】

item.title: 研究发现：外国企业在德国的投资降至十年来最低点
item.description: IW 研究所周四的一项研究显示，去年外国企业在德国的投资创下了十年来的最低水平，欧洲最大的经济体正面临着去工业化的担忧。【原文：Investment in Germany by foreign firms was at its lowest level in a decade last year, an IW institute study showed on Thursday, as de-industrialisation fears loomed over Europe's largest economy.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司准备发行 10 年期美元债券，条款表显示
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份条款表，新加坡航空公司（SIA）以美国国债加110个基点的利率发行了5亿美元的10年期美元债券。【原文：Singapore Airlines or SIA has launched a $500 million 10-year dollar bond at U.S Treasuries plus 110 basis points, according to a term sheet seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 通胀数据和零售销售数据公布前期货上涨
item.description: 由于投资者在美联储下周会议之前等待包括生产者价格数据在内的一系列经济数据，追踪华尔街主要股指的期货周四走高。【原文：Futures tracking Wall Street's main stock indexes advanced on Thursday as investors awaited a raft of economic data, including the producer prices numbers, ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting next week.】

item.title: 思科 280 亿美元收购 Splunk 获得欧盟反垄断许可
item.description: 周三，思科系统公司以 280 亿美元收购网络安全公司 Splunk 的交易获得了欧盟无条件反垄断批准，因为欧盟监管机构表示，他们没有发现任何竞争问题。【原文：Cisco Systems won unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $28 billion bid for cybersecurity firm Splunk on Wednesday after EU regulators said they did not see any competition issues.】

item.title: 汉堡王母公司 Restaurant Brands 任命内部人士 Sami Siddiqui 担任首席财务官
item.description: 餐厅品牌国际公司（Restaurant Brands International）周四任命萨米-西迪基（Sami Siddiqui）为首席财务官，并对其他领导层进行了一系列调整，以推进公司的长期目标，应对部分国际市场的疲软。【原文：Restaurant Brands International on Thursday named Sami Siddiqui as its chief financial officer and made a slew of other leadership changes, as the company pushes ahead with its long-term goals and navigates weakness in some international markets.】

item.title: NatWest 银行破产后，英国提议制定 "去银行化 "法律
item.description: 英国前脱欧党魁奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）去年曾表示，他因政治原因被 "去职"，此后，英国周四提出了一项法律草案，要求银行在关闭客户账户前必须提前三个月通知客户并做出解释。【原文：Britain proposed a draft law on Thursday that will compel banks to give customers three months' notice and an explanation before closing their accounts, after former Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage said last year he was 'debanked' on political grounds.】

item.title: 由于成本紧缩，Dollar General 预计 2024 年利润低于预期
item.description: 周四，Dollar General 与竞争对手 Dollar Tree 一样，预计年度利润低于华尔街预期，这表明成本上升以及顾客消费转向低利润消费品对其利润率造成了影响。【原文：Dollar General joined rival Dollar Tree in projecting annual profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, in a sign that higher costs as well as a shift in customer spending towards lower-margin consumables weighed on its margins.】

item.title: 2 月份托管资产强劲增长，Robinhood 跳涨
item.description: Robinhood Markets 周四在盘前交易中股价攀升近 13%，此前该经纪公司报告 2 月份托管资产强劲增长，表明加密货币和股票交易的回暖将继续推动该公司的发展。【原文：Robinhood Markets shares climbed nearly 13% in premarket trading on Thursday after the brokerage reported strong growth in assets under custody for the month of February, signaling continued boost from a comeback in cryptocurrency and stock trading.】

item.title: 气候适应投资者路线图为应对全球变暖指明方向
item.description: 几个关注气候问题的组织在周四的一份报告中说，更快、更猛烈的野火和其他自然灾害正在激发投资者的兴趣，让他们把赌注押在如何适应不可避免的气候变化上。【原文：Faster and more furious wildfires and other natural disasters are sparking investors' interest in betting on how to adapt to inevitable changes to the climate, several climate-focused groups said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 英伟达下周让开发者一睹新人工智能芯片的风采
item.description: Nvidia 及其首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）作为科技界人工智能芯片的主导供应商，还能撑多久？【原文：How long can Nvidia and its CEO, Jensen Huang, wear the crown as the tech world's dominant supplier of artificial-intelligence chips?】

item.title: 中国汽车制造商海外设厂，出口影响力引发摩擦
item.description: 在外国监管机构酝酿对进口中国制造的电动汽车采取措施之际，寻求全球增长的中国汽车制造商正在海外市场建设更多的汽车工厂。【原文：Chinese automakers seeking global growth are building more car factories in overseas markets, as foreign regulators mull imposing measures against imports of China-made electric cars.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Aareal 银行所有者聘请顾问出售房地产贷款机构的技术部门
item.description: 三位熟知内情的人士告诉路透社，随着德国房地产贷款机构在全球范围内遭遇商业地产紧缩，Aareal 银行的所有者已经为出售其技术部门物色好了顾问。【原文：The owners of Aareal Bank have lined up advisers to sell its tech unit, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the German property lender navigates a global crunch in commercial real estate.】

item.title: 分析师称中国削减汽车首付的计划可能落空
item.description: 分析师说，中国通过降低汽车贷款首付来促进汽车销售的努力将因价格战和消费者的谨慎而受挫，主要受益者是特斯拉和尼奥等少数几个受到年轻买家青睐的品牌。【原文：China's efforts to boost auto sales by cutting downpayments on car loans stand to be frustrated by a price war and consumer caution, chiefly benefiting a few brands favoured by younger buyers, such as Tesla and Nio , analysts said.】

item.title: 分析师称，由于炼油厂停工抑制了供应，美国油泵价格将跳涨
item.description: 分析师说，由于炼油厂大面积停工，在季节性需求激增之前减少了供应，未来几周美国驾车者很可能会看到汽油价格大幅上涨。【原文：U.S. motorists are likely to see gasoline prices turn sharply higher in the coming weeks as major refinery outages have cut supplies ahead of a seasonal jump in demand, analysts said.】

item.title: 美国进出口银行将就巴林石油项目进行投票，考验美国的气候承诺
item.description: 美国出口信贷机构周四将投票决定是否支持为巴林的一个石油和天然气钻探项目提供 1 亿美元贷款，这是对美国停止支持扩大化石燃料使用的项目的气候承诺的考验。【原文：The United States export credit agency on Thursday will vote on whether to back a $100 million loan for an oil and gas drilling project in Bahrain, testing a U.S. climate pledge to stop backing projects that expand the use of fossil fuels.】

item.title: 独家报道Citgo 拍卖出价疲软促使委内瑞拉提出替代薪酬计划
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士称，在决定委内瑞拉炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 命运的美国股票拍卖中，最高出价为 73 亿美元，仅够支付法院批准的索赔额的三分之一。【原文：The highest bid received in a U.S. auction of shares that will decide the fate of Venezuela-owned oil refiner Citgo Petroleum was $7.3 billion, enough to cover only a third of court-approved claims, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 聚焦：福特为小型企业卡车车队的软件销售制定了宏伟目标
item.description: 俄克拉荷马州塔尔萨市的供暖和制冷维修公司 HomeTown Services 正准备在部分卡车上安装司机监控摄像头，并已使用流媒体数据提醒司机不要在闲置车辆上坐太久，以免浪费汽油。【原文：HomeTown Services, a heating and cooling repair company in Tulsa, Oklahoma, is getting ready to install driver monitoring cameras in some of its trucks, and already uses streamed data to remind drivers not to sit too long in idle vehicles, wasting gasoline.】

item.title: 美国 通胀前景黯淡，特斯拉驶入慢车道
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，现代汽车因漏油风险在美国召回 28,439 辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，现代汽车美国公司（Hyundai Motor America）将在美国召回28,439辆汽车，因为机油泄漏可能会增加发动机舱起火的风险。【原文：Hyundai Motor America is recalling 28,439 vehicles in the U.S. as a possible oil leak may increase the risk of an engine compartment fire, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 现代和起亚因软件问题在韩国召回近17万辆电动汽车
item.description: 韩国交通部周四表示，现代汽车公司和姊妹公司起亚公司将在韩国召回约17万辆电动汽车（EV），原因是充电系统软件存在问题。【原文：Hyundai Motor Co and sister company Kia Corp will recall about 170,000 electric vehicles (EVs) in South Korea over problems with software in the charging systems, South Korea's transport ministry said on Thursday.】

item.title: 大众品牌成本削减计划初见成效
item.description: 大众汽车公司周四表示，去年其核心大众市场品牌的营业利润增长了 80%，这表明它们之间更紧密的合作正在结出硕果。【原文：Volkswagen said on Thursday that operating profit for its core mass-market brands increased by 80% last year, in a sign that closer cooperation between them is bearing fruit.】

item.title: 国际能源署认为经济逆风阻碍了需求增长
item.description: 国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）周四表示，疫后动荡的平息和经济前景的阴霾将抑制今年的需求增长，尽管航运中断会带来短期提振。【原文：The settling down of post-pandemic turbulence and a cloudy economic outlook will rein in demand growth this year, the International Energy Agency said on Thursday, even as shipping disruptions provide a short-term boost.】

item.title: 经合组织称瑞银拯救瑞士信贷为瑞士带来新风险
item.description: 经济合作与发展组织（Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development）周四表示，瑞银一年前对瑞士信贷（Credit Suisse）的拯救性收购给瑞士经济带来了 "新的风险和挑战"，这是对该交易表示担忧的最新一个国际论坛。【原文：UBS's rescue takeover of Credit Suisse a year ago has created "new risks and challenges" for the Swiss economy, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Thursday, the latest international forum to raise concerns about the deal.】

item.title: KKR 向恩凯维发出 30 亿美元公开收购要约
item.description: 私募股权公司 KKR 周四表示，已向德国电力和能源生产商 Encavis 发出 28 亿欧元（30.6 亿美元）的收购要约。【原文：Private equity firm KKR has launched a 2.8 billion-euro ($3.06 billion) takeover offer for German electricity and energy producer Encavis , the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 德意志银行首席执行官 2023 年薪酬降至 870 万欧元
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）首席执行官克里斯蒂安-斯温（Christian Sewing）周四在其年度报告中表示，在利润下降之后，该行2023年的收入为870万欧元（约合952万美元），略低于2022年的890万欧元。【原文：Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing earned 8.7 million euros ($9.52 million) in 2023, down slightly from 8.9 million euros in 2022 after a fall in profit, the bank said in its annual report on Thursday.】

item.title: 日元疲软，新加坡盈科将重启日本豪华滑雪胜地基金
item.description: 日本北部一个价值 14.2 亿美元的豪华滑雪场项目背后的新加坡投资者 Patience Capital Group 正在洽谈重新开放其基金，以吸引急于在日本央行收紧货币政策之前进入的新投资者。【原文：Patience Capital Group, the Singapore-based investor behind a $1.42 billion luxury ski project in northern Japan, is in talks to reopen its fund to new investors eager to get in before tightening by the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 金融服务管理局称啤酒商百威英博股票被暂停交易
item.description: 比利时金融服务和市场管理局（FSMA）周四表示，安海斯-布希英博公司股票暂停交易，等待发布新闻稿，但未作详细说明。【原文：Anheuser-Busch InBev's shares were suspended from trading on Thursday pending the publication of a press release, Belgium's Financial Services and Markets Authority (FSMA) said without elaborating.】

item.title: 中国外交部称美国提议的 TikTok 禁令 "不公平
item.description: 中国外交部发言人周四表示，以国家安全为由削弱其他国家的竞争优势 "毫无公平可言"，并批评了美国提出的强制剥离或禁止 TikTok 的法案。【原文：There is "no fairness to speak of" in citing national security to reduce the competitive advantage of other countries, a spokesperson of the Chinese foreign ministry said on Thursday, criticising a U.S. bill to force a TikTok divestiture or ban.】

item.title: 欧洲股市徘徊在历史最高水平附近；美国经济数据即将出炉
item.description: 欧洲股市周四开盘走高，一系列乐观的企业最新消息为其提供了支撑，而在美国关键经济数据公布前，投资者仍持谨慎态度。【原文：European shares opened higher on Thursday, supported by a raft of optimistic corporate updates, while investors remained cautious ahead of key economic data from the United States.】
